dungeoncrawler.map

Class MonsterGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • dungeoncrawler.map.MonsterGenerator

  • public class MonsterGenerator
extends Object
    This class provides methods that can be used to generate monsters to be used on each level.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      MonsterGenerator()

    • Constructor Detail

      • MonsterGenerator

        public MonsterGenerator()

    • Method Detail

      • getMonstersForLevel

        public List<Creature> getMonstersForLevel(LevelData levelData)
        Generates a list of randomly created monsters. The amount of monsters to be created is specified within the levelData object and depends on the current map level.
        Parameters:
        levelData - reference to the levelData object which stores information on current level and level difficulty
        Returns:
        a list of randomly created monsters

      • createRandomMonster

        public NPC createRandomMonster(LevelData levelData)
        Creates a random monster. The monster has a random amount of health and damage, as well as a variable aggro radius. All stats are also multiplied by the level difficulty multiplier which is determined in the levelData object, so that on each level monsters get tougher. On average, one third of monsters are not hostile.
        Parameters:
        levelData - reference to the levelData object which stores information on current level and level difficulty
        Returns:
        returns an NPC object which represents a randomly generated monster
